oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of vaginal temperature on behavior patterns of Mannheimia haemolytico challenged beef heifer calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Abell, K. M.
Theurer, M. E.
Larson, R. L.
Mosier, D. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: behavior
body temperature
beef cattle
Mannheimia haemolytica
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Behavior is one criteria that can be used to identify sick animals, but the relationship between behavior and body temperature changes are not well-defined. The objective of this project was to evaluate associations between vaginal temperature and behavior in beef heifers challenged with Mannheimia haemolytica.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 204
